main event: Mr. John Doe and his son reported sighting an unidentified flying object while hunting near Alexis Creek, British Columbia, on November 6, 1962.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at approximately 8:30 PM,The object was described as cylindrical in shape, black in color, and silent in operation,It was estimated to be about 75 feet in length and 20 feet in diameter,The object was sighted for approximately 3 minutes before it disappeared,The object moved at a slow speed and altered its course several times during the sighting.
sighted object: cylindrical black object in the sky
witness description: Mr. John Doe and his son
